I acknowledge the potential logistical hurdles that direct voting and campaign spending limits might pose. However, it's important to note that these changes could potentially provide a more accurate reflection of the voters' choice. Direct voting can eliminate the complexities of the electoral college, and spending limits can even out the playing field for all candidates. So, while these changes would indeed require careful planning and resources, they might offer a more efficient and straightforward election process.

Our rate of uninsured, the percentage of uninsured in Texas has gone down, while the percentage of uninsured in America has gone up. Our CHIPS program got a late start because our government meets only four months out of every two years, Mr. Vice President. And therefore Congress passes the bill after our session in 1997 ended, we passed an enabling legislation in 1999. Weve signed up over 110, 000 children to the CHIPS program. We spent a lot of money to make sure people get health care in the State of Texas, and were doing a better job than they are at the national level for reducing uninsured.
